Entries.info: Commands the motor to spin with the given PWM.  This will apply a voltage to the motor equal to supply voltage times PWM.
Commands the motor to spin with the given voltage.
Commands the motor to go to the given angle.
Commands the motor to spin at the given velocity.
Puts the motor into coast mode.  The motor will gently decelerate to zero velocity.
Puts the motor into brake mode.  The motor will quickly decelerate to zero velocity.
The final location of the trajectory.  This alone will not move the motor.  A Trajectory Duration or Trajectory Average Velocity is required after sending the desired Trajectory Angular Displacement.

The final velocity of the trajectory.  This will default to 0 if no Trajectory Angular Velocity is specified.  This alone will not move the motor.  A Trajectory Angular Displacement is required as well as a Trajectory Duration or Trajectory Average Velocity.

The final acceleration of the trajectory.  This will default to 0 if no Trajectory Angular Acceleration is specified.  This alone will not move the motor.  A Trajectory Angular Displacement is required as well as a Trajectory Duration or Trajectory Average Velocity.
The time duration of the trajectory.  The receipt of this command initiates the trajectory.  This may be used in place of Trajectory Average Speed.
The average speed of the trajectory.  The receipt of this command initiates the trajectory.  This may be used in place of Trajectory Duration.
